message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SI

This paper deals with the security and networking aspects of Bitcoin mining, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also involves data analysis and computational aspects, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper discusses the centralization tendencies in cryptocurrencies, which falls under the sub-category cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
